methods.handleException:
Notify the listener that an exception was encountered while initiating or maintaining the subscription.
 Delivery of an exception implies that the subscription is no longer valid.
 This might happen during subscription establishment, and consequently should be checked for after
 subscribe completes.

:param exception: (io.deephaven.db.v2.locations.TableDataException) - The exception
methods.handleTableLocation:
Notify the listener of a table location encountered while initiating or maintaining the location
 subscription.  This should occur at most once per location, but the order of delivery is not
 guaranteed.

:param tableLocation: (io.deephaven.db.v2.locations.TableLocation) - The table location
methods.processPending:
Subscribe if needed, and return any pending locations (or throw a pending exception) from the table location
 provider.
 A given location will only be returned by a single call to processPending() (unless state is reset).
 No order is maintained internally.
 If a pending exception is thrown, this signals that the subscription is no longer valid and no
 subsequent locations will be returned.

:return: (java.util.Collection<io.deephaven.db.v2.locations.TableLocation>) The collection of pending locations
methods.reset: Unsubscribe and clear any state pending processing.

text: Intermediates between push-based subscription to a TableLocationProvider and polling on LiveTable refresh.
